skills.name: Recognise the place value of each digit in integers

explanations.A: Not quite, that's the hundreds place.
explanations.B: The digits in this number are hundreds, tens, ones, so 3 is in the tens place.
explanations.C: Not quite, that's the ones place.
explanations.D: You need to choose one of the digits of this number - is 4, 3 or 8 in the tens place?

explanations.A: Not quite, that's the hundreds place.
explanations.B: Not quite, that's the tens place.
explanations.C: The digits in this number are hundreds, tens, ones, so 4 is in the ones place.
explanations.D: You need to choose one of the digits of this number - is 9, 3 or 4 in the ones place?

explanations.A: This number is three hundred and eight, so 3 hundreds, 0 tens and 8 ones.
explanations.B: Not quite - this number has 3 tens and 8 ones. What can we put in the tens place to show there are no tens?
explanations.C: Almost, but this number has 8 tens instead of 8 ones.
explanations.D: Not quite - you have mixed up the hundreds and the ones.

explanations.A: Not quite - you have mixed up the hundreds and the tens.
explanations.B: Almost, but this number has 2 ones instead of 2 tens.
explanations.C: Not quite - this number has 9 tens and 2 ones. Remember you can use 0 since we have no ones...
explanations.D: This number is nine hundred twenty, so 9 hundreds, 2 tens and 0 ones.

explanations.A: Not quite - remember the values of the digits are hundreds, tens, ones.
explanations.B: The values of the digits are hundreds, tens, ones, so 6 is in the ones place.
explanations.C: Not quite - remember the values of the digits are hundreds, tens, ones. A number with thousands in would need at least 4 digits.
explanations.D: Not quite - remember the values of the digits are hundreds, tens, ones.

explanations.A: Not quite - remember the values of the digits are hundreds, tens, ones.
explanations.B: Not quite - remember the values of the digits are hundreds, tens, ones.
explanations.C: Not quite - remember the values of the digits are hundreds, tens, ones. A number with thousands in would need at least 4 digits.
explanations.D: The values of the digits are hundreds, tens, ones, so 7 is in the hundreds place.

explanations.A: Not quite - remember the values of the digits are hundreds, tens, ones. Which place is the 7 in?
explanations.B: Not quite - remember the values of the digits are hundreds, tens, ones. Which place is the 7 in?
explanations.C: 7 is in the hundreds place, so its value is 7 hundreds or 700.
explanations.D: Not quite - this number only has hundreds, tens and ones. A number with thousands in has at least four digits.

explanations.A: Not quite - remember the values of the digits are hundreds, tens, ones. Which place is the 5 in?
explanations.B: 5 is in the tens place, so its value is 5 tens or 50.
explanations.C: Not quite - remember the values of the digits are hundreds, tens, ones. Which place is the 5 in?
explanations.D: Not quite - this number only has hundreds, tens and ones. A number with thousands in has at least four digits.

explanations.A: Can you see that each of the big blocks has 100 little cubes in, and each stick has 10 little cubes in? What number does 2 hundreds and 3 tens make?
explanations.B: Each green block has 100 cubes, so two blocks make 200. Each yellow stick has 10 cubes, so three sticks make 30. Altogether, 230.
explanations.C: Almost, but the yellow sticks don't represent ones. How many little cubes are in each stick?
explanations.D: I think you mixed up the hundreds and tens. We have 3 hundreds and 2 tens, what number is that?

explanations.A: Can you see that each of the big blocks has 100 little cubes in, and each stick has 10 little cubes in? What number does 3 hundreds and 5 tens make?
explanations.B: Almost, but the yellow sticks don't represent ones. How many little cubes are in each stick?
explanations.C: Each green block has 100 cubes, so three blocks make 300. Each yellow stick has 10 cubes, so five sticks make 50. Altogether, 350.
explanations.D: I think you mixed up the hundreds and tens. We have 3 hundreds and 5 tens, what number is that?
